page.title: 02Farming in Cardinham
page.content: FARMING Farms in this area are not generally very big and many are smallholders with under 50 acres. The good farmland is all intensively managed and supports large numbers of animals.The bigger farms grow some arable crops.Some of the land is enclosed grazings which are either privately or more usually used by farmers with commons grazing rights.There is also a small amount of land that has moorland vegitation usually this is also subject to commons grazing rights. Farms with dairy herds are few and they do not have large herds.Most farms are beef and sheep farms,those with commons grazings usually have a suckler herd producing beef.
